Our front-end integration is in JavaScript and Coffeescript. We have also developed a domain specific language to describe eCommerce personalization in terms of predicates on customers and products. We build many internal and customer facing tools, including an innovative template editing CMS on top of Github. Even though our first application is currently focused on email, we are a company that deals with massive amounts of data. We ingest massive amounts of data about customers, and the products they look at, the size, color, brand etc - and process all of that in real time! ** Why work at Bluecore? 1. We handle very large real time datasets; we're 18 months old and have a 12TB well structured dataset. 2. Our engineers are given large responsibilities. We consider them smart creatives not shackled with 4-hour tasks. 3. We have about 700 unit tests. We parallelize them on many machines to ensure that the test suite always runs in under 3 minutes. 4. We handle many thousands of requests per second, but that increases every day as we grow. 5. We deploy many many times to production every day. Requirements SKILLS Python, Javascript, E-Commerce, Google App Engine, General Software Hardcore-Ness Benefits Highly competitive compensation package and opportunity to work for one of the fastest growing start-ups in New York City. There is a balance to strike to achieve this and we respect it. Full medical, dental and vision benefits program. software engineer	10001	30	100	fulltime	0	You --- Noom is looking for an awesome Software Engineer who's a true team player and passionate about engineering, with tons of programming experience (doesn't matter if it was at Apple or in your mom’s basement) and excellent communication skills. A CS background or degree usually helps a lot, but is not a strict requirement if you really know your stuff. Our Tech -------- At our core, we are a team of great engineers from world-class companies, so we take our tech very seriously. We work to improve our tools and approaches every day -- whether pushing the envelope with automated unit-tests or writing a super-optimized data analysis framework. We don't over-engineer and also don't under-engineer -- just the right tool for the job. We take great pride in our code because we all want to innovate quickly. We build everything from Android software to C++ image recognition, from web UI to pedometer data analysis. Our apps operate off-line, and we have built lots of client-side infrastructure to lazily load and sync data with the server. This allows us to keep the server side relatively simple while still serving millions of users: Spring/Flask, Spring MVC, mySQL/Mongo. We run Hadoop-based machine learning to find out what makes people stick to habits, create online clustering algorithms to match people to their ideal support group, serve millions of users with many terabytes of data, and tackle many difficult challenges ( http://www.quora.com/Noom-company/What-are-some-of-the-engineering-challenges-at-Noom ) every day. Because we are small dev team (17 strong), working at Noom gives you the unique opportunity to both use what we have created and build many more foundational technologies. Our Culture ----------- We have worked hard to build an awesome companyculture ( http://www.noom.com/culture.php ), stealing a bit from Google (many of us are ex-Googlers) and improving on it to become one ofCrain’s “Best Places to Work in NYC 2013” ( http://www.crainsnewyork.com/gallery/20131206/FEATURES/120909999/64 ) Our tech team works with a ton of interesting Noomers and advisers, including our in-house psychologist as well as fitness experts, physicians and researchers. We test our prototypes on sample users, averaging 2 user-tests a day, so you’ll be able to see how real people react to your work and iterate. So unlike most tech companies, you’ll interact with a diverse network of people. After all, we are team of problem solvers, always interested in learning and growing. If you’re worried about being pigeonholed, fear not. You’ll get to choose a mission (usually for 4 - 6 months) and work on the projects you’re interested in. We also have frequent company-wide hackathons. Everyone on the team is a generalist -- we explore new frameworks, and learn them quickly. We like to learn. We are now ready to double the size of our engineering team with some incredible engineers (read on below!). Our Company ----------- Noom, Inc. is a mobile solutions company focused on preventative health. Noom's research-backed products help people achieve real, positive outcomes. Noom was awarded a grant from the National Institutes of Health (NIH) and was also recently selected as one of seven healthcare startups chosen to participate in the 2014 New York Digital Health Accelerator ( http://globenewswire.com/Tracker?data=DvPUraXhoslsKGXRwlIy5idCG421QVvrQs10fsQVoGAr_Z5G0QPBzQHwKLndQqzmbk6-UHguicwM7TjVMQp0KkBKLNRQWufHi_P66vMucDYpvG7WgKa8ojQUtte_Y8_5 ) (NYDHA). Noom's apps boast more than 32 million installs worldwide and its flagship app Noom Coach ( http://globenewswire.com/Tracker?data=x7pI0mj2kMlL5sy0iXAmZQ5cYiBZ6rFpAnmNXZn_kD1z1DggQqcTsmPQBN8iHQ2Z7harrWHTkX8b3wDYzuSoipVJeR1U2lZepA5gBHH45OCOyWUyJWlXuY8fhOG2QTBY ) for Android has been the #1 top grossing Health and Fitness App since 2012 in the Google Play Store. Noom has offices in New York City, Berlin, Seoul and Tokyo. But we need your help -- read on if you think you’ve got the stuff. Our Products ------------ At Noom we tackle some of the world’s biggest problems -- obesity, diabetes and heart disease. We believe the best way to do this is by focusing on nutrition (TechCrunch ( http://techcrunch.com/2013/10/22/health-startup-noom-receives-nih-grant-to-study-smartphone-tech-in-eating-disorder-treatment/ )) and fitness (GigaOm ( http://gigaom.com/2013/06/11/nooms-android-fitness-app-another-example-of-why-smartphones-are-the-original-wearable-computers/ )). More than just counting calories, our mobile software applications offer intelligent, scientifically-backed, customized nutrition- and exercise-coaching designed to impact habits and behavior. Our flagship app, Noom Weight Loss Coach, has been the #1 top grossing health &amp; fitness application since 2012. It achieves the best outcomes in the industry with over 10 pounds lost per paid member. How, you ask? Great question! It has: A coaching engine that generates personalized daily tasks &amp; realtime motivational feedback; The world’s most accurate food database, crowd-sourced by users &amp; instantly searchable; Virtual support groups created using automated clustering technology and tracked using scalable management tools. A focus on simplicity and friendliness, to make all of the above easy to use Many more features focused around guidance &amp; motivation for our users Our Benefits ------------ If you want to learn how a startup really works on the inside, then Noom is the place for you. We have an incredible amount of transparency, with weekly all-company TGIFs where the wine and the information both flow freely (much to our legal counsel’s dismay). Because you’ll have equity in the company and have to make many decisions in your work, it’s important for you to know what’s going on. We have an amazing chef (we love her!) who prepares gourmet lunches every day for all employees (along with afternoon smoothies and random breakfasts and dinners), a lively office with frequent visitors, and a dedicated team who work hard and play hard, with frequent offsites (beach, anyone?) and team outings (from shuffleboard to wine tasting). We also have more cakes than is probably healthy (welcome cakes, birthday cakes, goodbye cakes and cakes just because -- no joke). Plus health insurance (100% paid by Noom) and a 401(k). We also have a $200 wellness budget, which you can spend on everything from triathlon registration fees to massages. You have experience combining APIs and other data sources to build powerful tools, and you are interested in deriving meaningful insights from vast data. In short, you're an extremely strong generalist who loves picking up the project with the greatest potential for immediate impact on the business. You will help drive Artsy's continued growth by: Planning &amp; building internal applications that leverage external APIs Supporting data gathering automation and structuring Integrating and building new marketing and analytics tools to support new growth projects You are the kind of person who: Has a strong passion for growth projects Has a bias towards action and rapid iteration Has experience with testing and validation Has a good eye for product and usability Enjoys solving technical problems creatively Wants to serve as a resource for others, and learn from them OUR STACK Artsy has 35 services and applications in production. Check out this post about our tech stack. WHAT IS ARTSY In a sentence, Artsy is like Pandora for the fine art world. Our mission is to make the the world's art easily accessible to anyone with an Internet connection. By increasing access, we believe we can expand the art market and get more people educated and passionate about fine art. ARTSY'S CULTURE AND WORK ENVIRONMENT At its core, Artsy is a technology company. In addition to the engineering team, both the CEO and COO have technical backgrounds (Computer Science from Princeton, and Mathematics from Columbia). Our ultimate goal is to create Artificial Intelligence with the qualities of the world's most omniscient art advisor. To create an awesome UX we employ cutting-edge technologies such as Node.js, Backbone.js, Coffeescript, Haml, Sass, Ruby on Rails, and MongoDB; but when we can't find a technology that does what we need,we create one. We write our own open-source projects and contribute them back to the community. There are no set hours or holidays, no pointless bureaucracy. Work whenever you want, wherever you want. That's the beauty of hiring world-class people, they deliver incredible results and are wonderful to work with — what else matters? Our downtown Manhattan office has stunning 360 degree views of New York. You can see the horizon in all 4 directions, the iconic midtown and downtown skylines, the Hudson and East rivers. We have super-value-add investors and advisors including: Peter Thiel, Jack Dorsey, Eric Schmidt, Joe Kennedy (CEO of Pandora), Charlie Cheever (Quora founder), Alexis O'Hanian (Reddit founder), Keith Rabois (COO Square), Founder Collective, Dave Morin (Path founder), Wendi Murdoch, Dasha Zhukova, and Thrive Capital. At Artsy, we are bringing art, science, design, and engineering together. We hire engineers who are creative and empathetic, and we hire art historians who can think analytically and make data-informed decisions. We want to help users find, discover, and fall in love with art. If you do too, please drop us a line and include some links to what you've built: fsse_growth@artsy.net. software engineer	10001	30	100	fulltime	0	About the Team: At AppNexus, our data is our life line - we can only be as good as our data, and great data is critical for business success. Our data pipeline processes tens of billions of log records a day (more than 150TB of data) generated by our real-time bidding engines and ad serving platform. Data volume has rocketed over the past year and is continuing to increase – we have petabytes of data on store at this very moment. This data is used to generate aggregated analytics reports, update budgets, and drive optimization engines. We build technology that identifies and analyzes relevant data to match buyers and sellers such that they each achieve their business initiatives. To do this, engineers partner with our Data Science team - implementing, testing and deploying complex models and intuitive, high-performance solutions for our diverse client base. Consider Some of the Problems You Will Try to Solve: Conversion attribution: In online advertising, we have to figure out events caused a particular conversion – or which ad impression caused a user to make a purchase. We hunt for the needle in a 150 billion-row “haystack,” and we do this millions of times every hour. We then use this to infer why the conversion happened and how we can change our real-time buying strategy to achieve more of these. Processing data fast and reliably : Our team is processing more and more data, pushing our decision engines to run with as little latency as possible. We value people who aren’t constrained to particular technologies and are eager to learn new things to overcome anything that stands in the way of delivering value to players. We intentionally don’t post hundreds of engineering job openings on our website, with specific technical requirements for each, because we believe that engineers don’t follow narrow archetypes; instead we want to work with candidates who are interested in joining Riot to identify the area and team where they can have the biggest impact. We work in virtually every technical domain imaginable. As a software engineer at Riot, you might: * Work on a diverse, cross-functional team that is defining the future evolution of League of Legends : a big game, with a big playerbase, and big demands * Work closely with artists, designers, and engineers on R&amp;D teams to breathe life into game concepts * Build a massive global platform for deploying and operating backend services with low latency and high availability * Extend the big data pipeline that turns petabytes of anonymized user data into useful insights on how players behave and help inform decisions to keep game experiences balanced and fresh * Design and implement cutting edge web user interfaces that allow players to interact with each other and the League of Legends universe in new and exciting ways * Write cross-platform code to power native applications on disparate mobile devices in order to allow players to connect with each other from anywhere on the planet * Develop awesome experiences and products optimized for players around the world in one of our local offices * Delight players in one of hundreds of roles that aren’t explicitly mentioned here While our engineers come in all shapes and sizes and work with many technologies, we expect every engineer at Riot to be: * Player-focused: you’re a gamer whose passion for games (especially League of Legends ) helps you stay focused on initiatives that make the difference to players in and out of the game * A threat to convention : bored by what’s considered traditional, you constantly push past limits until the status is no longer quo; you don’t “think outside the box” because, hey, there's no box * Focused on team : you find, shape, and cultivate teams that don’t just swing for the fences, they jack that (metaphorical) baseball beyond the stars; you help Rioters develop the tools and creative atmosphere to shine, but ultimately hold them accountable for making smart calls and delivering capital-V value * Seriously playful : you work hard but always leave time for pentakills; whether you’re grabbing a game of League in our onsite PC Bang or rapidly sharing cat GIFs, you make time for daily play in all of its wonderful forms * Humbitious : you’re ambitious but humble, a state of being summed up by fans of portmanteau as “humbitious;” always shooting for the stars, you never forgo rounds of feedback from teammates, players, and partners who keep you from drifting off into space We receive a lot of applications, but we’ll notice a fun, well-written intro that shows us you take play seriously. Apply below and don’t forget to include a resume and cover letter. software engineer	10001	30	100	fulltime	0	Animoto is looking for a solid Test Engineer to round out our 7-person Test Team. Testers at Animoto are strongly embedded within product teams and partner with developers to increase confidence in our software. We are not trying to break systems that developers hand us, we’re working with developers to deeply understand and improve systems. Want to become an indispensable member of the engineering team? Read on... Test, as an engineering discipline, seems unusually vulnerable to existential crises. Every organization has a different perspective on test function, goals and deliverables. So we feel that a job posting needs to be fairly opinionated in terms of how we view “Test” at Animoto. Fundamentally, we believe TESTING IS ABOUT GETTING FEEDBACK FROM A SYSTEM. This is true whatever size of system we’re talking about, and whether we’re talking about a developer feeding inputs to a single function in console or a suite of automated UI tests running in the cloud. Testing is obviously not something that only testers do, but members of the Test Team are mostly focused on providing feedback and working on systems that can provide feedback. We try to avoid talking about ‘Quality Assurance’. This might just sound like semantics, but all teams need to care about quality and no one team can truly assure it. We value Automated testing and Exploratory testing. We do not write or run manual test scripts. Why you want to work at Animoto? ➼ You resonate with our Test philosophy and don't want to work anywhere that doesn't think about Test in that way. ➼ You want a chance to learn and grow as a Test Engineer. We encourage our testers towards deep understanding of the technologies and systems that they are testing. ➼ A powerful and cool product. We are a New York based tech company that strives to enable anyone to produce powerful, professional video. Our patented cinematic artificial intelligence takes photos, video clips and music, analyzes them and outputs videos with high-end production value that tell a compelling story. We have over 14 million users, both consumers and businesses, a web-based video editor, mobile apps for iOS and Android, and integrations with various partners including Shutterfly. Animoto has been featured in the Apple store more than once, have contributed significant pieces to the Open Source community, and is a hub for the tech community workshops and meetups. ➼ Great benefits. Great salary, equity, 15 days of Paid Time Off, paid Holidays, 401k, 100% paid medical, dental and vision (for you and your family), Flexible Spending Account, TransitChek, paid volunteer day, fully stocked kitchen, upgraded Amazon Prime and Pandora accounts, beer for you and your friends, field trips, and crockpots for the chili cookoff! ➼ Our offices are pretty great: See Inside ➼ Voted Crain's Best Places to Work ("Heaven for fun-loving, creative types") ➼ Some more reasons to work at Animoto! http://animoto.com/about/careers Why Animoto wants you? You have a solid background in testing and strong attention to detail (experience with financial system would be a plus too!). You already have, or want to gain, some automation and coding chops. Be part of the entire SDLC, finding better ways to test at all stages and improve our process Know and explain common classes of bugs to the engineering team. Finding a way to prevent those bugs is a big plus. Determine the types of testing your area needs, when it needs them, and how that integrates with the rest of engineering Determine how test results should be reported for your area to give everyone the fastest, most useful feedback about the state of the project Know which tests work better with human interaction and which are a better fit for full automation. Work with the rest of the team to plan and implement those tests. Requirements Understand something about different test methodologies and about web technologies and apps Good problem-solving skills. Be able to figure out which part of a large system isn’t working Dedication to experimentation and continual learning. Tell us about the last great test book you read and how you applied that knowledge for bonus points Coding, especially in Ruby, is nice to have. Experience with automated testing especially using selenium or similar is great. Aptitude and excitement to learn is required. Thanks! We are an equal opportunity employer. Check out our latest blog post about our tech stack. WHAT IS ARTSY? In a sentence, Artsy is like Pandora for the fine art world. Our goal: using artificial intelligence we want to make the traditionally closed-off and intimidating art world easily accessible to anyone with an Internet connection. We believe that by increasing access, we can expand the market and get more people educated and passionate about fine art. WHY WORK AT ARTSY? First and foremost, you will get to work with an amazing team. We invest an extraordinary amount of time finding the best possible people. This means we go through many candidates before making an offer, but as you know, five great engineers are better than a hundred good ones. High alignment between Artsy's business goals and user experience goals. The larger an audience we reach, the more we educate them, and the more we help them discover art they love, the better our business does, and the more we support our institutional partners and the artists they represent. There are no set hours or holidays, no pointless bureaucracy. Work whenever you want, wherever you want. That's the beauty of hiring world-class people, they deliver incredible results and are wonderful to work with — what else matters? The Netflix Culture slides do the best job of describing how we think about culture at Artsy. To create an awesome UX we employ cutting-edge technologies such as Node.js, Backbone.js, Coffeescript, Haml, Sass, Ruby on Rails, and MongoDB; but when we can't find a technology that does what we need… We write our own open-source projects and contribute them back to the community. We are solving very hard problems. To make art historically relevant recommendations, you can't rely on collaborative filtering alone. We do real-time search in 800 dimensional space (one dimension for every art historical category). We are also working on semantic search, fuzzy full-text search, visual similarity search, and high-resolution image tiling and security among others. At its core, Artsy is a technology company. In addition to the engineering team, both the CEO and COO have technical backgrounds (Computer Science from Princeton, and Mathematics from Columbia). Our ultimate goal is to create Artificial Intelligence with the qualities of the world's most omniscient art advisor. If Skynet ends up winning, at least it will have good taste : ). We have partnered with over 250 of the largest galleries in the world and several major art museums. No startup has ever come so close to unlocking this massive data set before. Our downtown Manhattan office has stunning 360 degree views of New York. You can see the horizon in all 4 directions, the iconic midtown and downtown skylines, the Hudson and East rivers. This is where we do Stand-up. We have super-value-add investors and advisors including: Peter Thiel, Jack Dorsey, Eric Schmidt, Joe Kennedy (CEO of Pandora), Charlie Cheever (Quora founder), Alexis O'Hanian (Reddit founder), Keith Rabois (COO Square), Founder Collective, Dave Morin (Path founder), Wendi Murdoch, Dasha Zhukova, and Thrive Capital. software engineer	10001	30	100	fulltime	0	When was the last time you were planning a business trip and really tried to save your company money? If your company allowed you to stay in a fancy hotel, would you ever volunteer to stay at an Airbnb or at a friend’s house? How about flying coach instead of business class? The vast majority of employees optimize for comfort and convenience, spending at the high end of their company policy limits, because, well, why not? So how can a company get its employees to care about expenses without implementing draconian policies, creating friction and frustrating employees? How can a company motivate its employees to save? The answer is Rocketrip. We’re a NYC-based startup that rewards business travelers for cost-sensitive behavior. It’s a win-win: companies save, while employees cash in with real rewards. The Role: Rocketrip software engineers have a penchant for solving unique problems. If you love and thrive on keeping up to date with and gaining a deep understanding of the latest web technologies, you will love working with us. Rocketrip is as much about web design as it is about employing diverse areas of Computer Science, including machine learning, information retrieval, distributed computing and natural language processing to transform the professional travel industry. We’re a group of tech innovators who looked at the current state of business travel, became frustrated by the horrible employee and employer experiences, and decided to do something big about it. Our team is focused on utilizing technology, design and data to align employee and company interests. Software Developer Engineer	RDM	New York	NY	New York, NY	RDM	Fri, 25 Sep 2015 02:21:32 GMT	http://www.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=3001401e572b46db&qd=Ag27krUCoaLJuWVlpFUHKktjrbXDUsGzyMoJ22wuFmuYgLKVtEhVAIpOvFFnlsacaqP1atIlMmY_bmEfJLkdXRMQli-LAMxEbxPM0buaSa1iVroc8Db9KtfQzuCg6-WZJLdCwlcv60Ip7jH1uO3v5g&indpubnum=1018862029525284&atk=1a3ke964719u52ao
software engineer	10001	30	100	fulltime	0	You will work on a fairly small, cross-functional team. A typical team will consist of about four developers, a dev manager, a project manager, a product manager, one or two QA engineers, one or two front-end engineers, a business analyst, an infrastructure engineer, a data engineer, and a creative — although things can vary depending on the nature of the work at hand. The team sits together, works as a fairly autonomous unit, and owns the accountability for delivering value. Teams don’t operate in a top-down fashion; if you’re on the team, then you’re on the team, and you’re expected to be freely interacting with everyone else on the team. Projects are run in an Agile fashion, although we do not strictly follow any one flavor. Suffice it to say that you will never have a pile of requirements flung over the wall at you, nor will you in turn fling your work over the wall to another team. While we do practice pairing, it’s not dogmatic. What you’ll often see is someone working through a problem for an hour or so, and then turning to the person next to them and walking them through what they’ve just done. There are times when full-on pairing makes sense, and times when it doesn’t make sense at all, but we leave that up to the developers to decide. We have a strong belief in the value of automated testing, so writing tests, designing for testability, and selecting good testing tools will be something that you’ll spend a significant amount of time thinking about. Most of the work that you’ll do will involve either adding features to one of our commerce sites, or helping to build out the platform on which they’re running. You can expect to be working with a mix of Java and Scala. If you have never worked with Scala, don’t worry, we’re perfectly happy to help you get up to speed. It’s a great language, and we’ve found that people really enjoy working with it. There is also some Clojure in our ecosystem, so you may get the chance to work with that as well. On the Scala side of things, we are heavily leveraging Akka and Play, as well. Skills &amp; Requirements Revision control is mostly done via git, although there’s still a bit of vestigial SVN here and there, at least for the short term. Code works its way into master via GitHub pull requests and peer code reviews. We’ve done a lot of work around automating builds and deployments, and techniques such as feature toggles and dark launches, so that we are not only able to release code frequently, but when we do, it’s a low-ceremony event. You will not be spending long nights on the phone slogging through deployments. Production support will happen, but we have a robust ecosystem, and solid monitoring, and good operational practice, so while you will spend part of your time helping to work through production issues, that time tends to happen during working hours. We also recognize that issues happen. When they do, we work on fixing them, there’s no blame game. You’re encouraged to use whatever tools (editors, IDE’s, etc) you are most comfortable with. You’ll also have a choice of a Mac or a PC for your laptop. We work to keep meetings to a minimum, so that people can focus on getting their work done. Most communication happens by looking up and talking to someone who’s at your table. Work hours are reasonable; we believe that engineers do their best work when they come to a job they like, work hard for eight hours or so, and then go home and relax. People don’t work weekends, and they don’t pull all-nighters — although we do believe that if we can keep you happy enough, and challenged enough, you’ll have some of your best ideas on the evenings and weekends. You’ll be strongly encouraged to spend time developing your professional skills. We have a liberal book budget, and if you can make a good case for why you should go to a conference / take a class, we can generally get you there. More importantly, we try to set aside about 20% of your week for you to be working on things that make you better at what you do. We’re pretty sure that the world in three years is not going to look very much like it does today, so we want to have people who are flexible, adaptable, curious, and constantly learning. You’ll find that you like your co-workers. Our culture works well, and it works because people like and respect each other — up, down, and across the organization. While that kind of culture is infectious, we also work to ensure that the people we add to the team have the kind of personality that will thrive in our environment. About HBC Digital, Saks Fifth Avenue Hudson’s Bay Company is a leading North American Retailer comprised of three of the retail industry’s most iconic brands – Hudson’s Bay, Lord &amp; Taylor and Saks Fifth Avenue including Saks Off5th outlets. The company operates 320 stores, including 179 full-line department stores, 73 outlet stores and 69 home stores in prime retail locations throughout the U.S. and Canada, along with four e-commerce sites. The storied retailer Hudson’s Bay Company which was founded in 1670 recently acquired Saks Fifth Avenue in November 2013, establishing a portfolio of retail banners addressing a broad consumer spectrum across the luxury, mid-tier and outlet retail sectors. HBC Digital is a new division at Hudson’s Bay Company. This will entail applying information and software security best practices, technologies and tools to the software design, implementation and sustainment of various iconectiv products and services\. The successful candidate will have hands\-on experience with the Software Development Lifecycle \(SDLC\) and applying robust Cybersecurity best practices to large database and high\-transaction and informational types of software systems, with particular expertise in software and system security testing, vulnerability analysis and the mitigation of identified Cybersecurity vulnerabilities\. This position will report to the Chief Information Security Officer, and work with solutions architects, and software development and operations staff to ensure that security best practices are considered, designed in, tested and verified and maintained throughout the SDLC\. Further, this position will assist in the effort to enhance a secure software development methodology and to evaluate associated tools and products to meet iconectiv requirements as well as meets the security policies set forth by the iconectiv CISO and customer requirements\. **Responsibilities: ** The Software Security Testing Engineer will: + Analyze, assess and identify cybersecurity and operational threats and vulnerabilities in iconectiv product and services’ software architecture and associated SDLC activities in delivering the customer service + Develop and document testing and analysis capabilities and methodologies to address the different types of security testing \(e\.g\., vulnerability scanning, penetration testing\) required for the software, systems and networks including third party products and services + Use security testing and assessment tools and methodologies to perform independent verification and validation \(IV&amp;V\) of the security of systems, applications, networks and data bases\. (ASCI), headquartered in Morristown, NJ, was founded in 1981 as a software engineering and consulting company specializing in the development of Strategic System Software Management Solutions. ASCI’s flagship product, ActiveBatch ® , is an Enterprise Job Scheduling and Workload Automation Solution that simplifies the complexity of automating and integrating business and IT processes across diverse distributed computing environments in order to lower the total-cost-of ownership that organizations are looking for. Through ActiveBatch's sensitivity to business process computing, workloads can be balanced across a variety of platforms including Microsoft Windows, UNIX, Linux and OpenVMS to ensure on-time execution on a "24x7" basis. Today, ActiveBatch has a worldwide customer base, deployed in 46 countries, and continues to provide improved system efficiency and utilization for software developers and systems managers. We use backbone.js extensively and chrome wrapper / webkit for native integration. This role is for a strong hands-on software engineer who also has outstanding communications skills. The successful candidate will be ready for a role that includes both directly contributing to the development of Symphony’s platform integration interfaces, and has the strong relationship management and communications skills to work directly with outside organizations to help create a complete technical solution. Why you are needed now: Symphony is a secure messaging startup backed by an array of the world’s leading financial institutions. Our clients and industry partners aim to create rich integrations with the Symphony front-end: Huge customer and industry demand for connections with 3rd party content and integration, and connections to enterprise applications Each one of these features needs to be maintainable, secure, and scalable to a large number of partner integrations Symphony is designed as an open platform which enables widespread integration. Platform integration is core to our product strategy. The problems you will be solving: Provide sophisticated front-end integration hooks into Symphony’s HTML5-based desktop wrapper, and a framework for securely embedding 3rd party content and applications in the front-end. Our clients are many large, sophisticated global enterprises who seek to integrate Symphony in a complex fashion with their internal systems. Our partners include application and content providers. Handling these complex stakeholders and delivering a strategic solution is the core of this challenging and crucial role. RESPONSIBILITIES Work with Product Designers and fellow developers to design and implement the next generation of Symphony’s front-end interfaces Work with clients and industry partners to explain how our interfaces work and assist in integrating with Symphony at both an architectural and code level Build efficient and reusable front-end abstractions and systems Identify and communicate best practices for front-end engineering REQUIREMENTS Outstanding technical communications skills and stakeholder management 5+ years experience developing JavaScript applications and REST interfaces Ability to write high-performance, reusable code for UI components Aware of but not reliant on Object Oriented JavaScript Frameworks (Prototype JS, MooTools, Dojo, etc.) Experience with backbone.js, angular.js, node.js, Vertex and similar technologies desired but not required BS or MS degree in Computer Science or a related technical field ABOUT SYMPHONY'S TECHNOLOGY STACK We selected Apache Kafka, Apache Solr, MongoDB and HBase due to their superior distributed nature, performance, reliability, and ability to scale to the volume of data generated by the expected workload. We built out the ReSTFUL web services layer in a stateless manner using Apache Tomcat, meaning capacity could be added linearly, by simply adding more boxes behind the load balancer. The client front end was conceived as a web client that could be delivered on any device, any operating system, anywhere in the world. To build it, we chose HTML5/CSS3, with JQuery, Backbone and Handlebars doing the bulk of the heavy lifting. Symphony's front-end web application uses the modular pattern made popular in CommonJS, which builds each component as a loosely coupled anonymous closure. The core of the JavaScript app handles request transport details, new message notifications and updates, configuration of the UI layout, and much more. These functions are abstracted behind a public sandbox and selectively bundled into modules when the components are loaded. This architecture helps Symphony add new components quickly and seamlessly because they are isolated from each other, and lets developers control exactly how much of the app needs to load—an architecture specifically designed for integration and customization. ABOUT SYMPHONY Designed for the exchange of high-value content, Symphony is a secure communication and workflow platform that improves workplace productivity and connects users to their professional and personal community. Symphony has attracted the world’s top financial institutions with a $66 million investment to develop a scalable, cloud-based and highly secure collaboration and communication platform that will address the enterprise and compliance requirements for the financial services industry. The Symphony platform is intended to be used by some of the most time-conscious firms on the planet who are regularly corresponding high-value information—where a delay of a few seconds can have significant cost implications. Symphony’s secure communication platform will be available to all financial institutions and professionals world-wide in mid-2015. Now we’re looking for top-notch engineers, programmers and marketers (etc.) to join our team in Palo Alto, CA and New York to help us change the way the world communicates. If you have the skills and savvy to work with a world-class team, and an appetite for game-changing disruption, we definitely want to hear from you. SYMPHONY BENEFITS Competitive salary based on experience, skills, and qualifications Medical, Dental, and Vision coverage 401(K) Plan Life and AD&amp;D coverage Short Term and Long Term Disability coverage Employee Assistance Program Flexible Spending Account benefits Uncapped vacation and sick time Fully stocked kitchen and catered lunches Discounted gym memberships Many other fun and exciting benefits and activities! software engineer	10001	30	100	fulltime	0	About the Team The AppNexus Platform has the capability to process tens of billions of log records a day (more than 150TB of data) generated by our real-time bidding engines and ad serving platform. Data volume has rocketed over the past year and is continuing to increase, reaffirming that AppNexus has one of the premier and most large scale “Big Data” environments in the world. AppNexus is continuously finding new ways to gather, process, store, and deliver this data to the proper resources. This information is used to generate billing &amp; invoices, aggregated analytics reports, update budgets, and drive advanced algorithmic and statistical decision-making engines. Clients rely on fast reporting and detailed analytics data to run their businesses. To that end, we aim to provide real-time stats and budgeting to freeze campaign spending as close to real-time as possible. Consider Some of the Problems We Try to Solve: Getting insight: Not only are we dealing with a growing body of data, but we also need to be able to process it rapidly, get insights and share it all with clients at whatever level of granularity they need. Processing data: We have built a platform that allows us to process data but many of our clients struggle to build tools that allow them to process our data directly. A key goal is to abstract out the functionality we have so our clients can benefit. New tools: We are always seeking new and better tools to help us meet challenges. For example, our data is so distributed that keeping it consistent globally is a major concern. To solve this problem, our team built Starfish—a monitoring tool that can self-heal any data discrepancies. software engineer	10001	30	100	fulltime	0	Date: Immediate Location: New York, NY Type: FTE (Full Time Employee) JOB DESCRIPTION Symphony is looking for a senior-level, server-side Java software engineer to support its exponential growth. As a Symphony Backend Engineer, you'll be designing and implementing the cloud-based server-side logic for our secure communications platform. Working closely with Symphony’s industry partners and large financial clients, you will help design and integrate external platforms with Symphony’s enterprise-class, secure, end-to-end encrypted messaging application. Our engineers design and implement utilizing open source stacks (e.g. hbase, kafka, solr), extreme scaling within the cloud, and encryption in transit/at rest. This role is for a strong hands-on software engineer who also has outstanding communications skills. The successful candidate will be ready for a role that includes both directly contributing to the development of Symphony’s platform integration interfaces, and has the strong relationship management and communications skills to work directly with outside organizations to help create a complete technical solution. Why you are needed now: Symphony is a secure messaging startup backed by an array of the world’s leading financial institutions. Our clients and industry partners aim to create rich integrations with the Symphony front-end: Huge customer and industry demand for connections with 3rd party content and integration, and connections to enterprise applications Each one of these features needs to be maintainable, secure, and scalable to a large number of partner integrations Symphony is designed as an open platform which enables widespread integration. Platform integration is core to our product strategy. The problems you will be solving: Provide sophisticated back-end integration hooks to deliver hooks into Symphony’s core messaging platform, supporting integration with secure message “bots,” content and trading platform information feeds, and other server-side applications. Our clients are large, sophisticated global enterprises who seek to integrate Symphony in a complex fashion with their internal systems. Our partners include many application and content providers. Handling these complex stakeholders and delivering a strategic solution is the core of this challenging and crucial role. RESPONSIBILITIES Participate in development of Symphony's Server / Backend Development Work with clients and industry partners to explain how our interfaces work and assist in integrating with Symphony at both an architectural and code level Design, implement and test highly scalable, multi-tier, distributed server software applications Design and implement distributed and highly concurrent Java based enterprise services Create maintainable and scalable features fit for use by demanding enterprise clients QUALIFICATIONS Outstanding technical communications skills and stakeholder management 10+ years experience in a Java server-side software design and development Solid background in fundamentals of computer science and development process Experience developing high quality centralized server based apps Experience with open source frameworks and tools BS or MS degree in Computer Science or a related technical field DESIRED BUT NOT REQUIRED NoSQL and SQL databases Experience deploying server applications on Google App Engine (GAE), Google Compute Engine GCE and Amazon Web Service (AWS) Experience with any of the following: Kafka, Solr, Tomcat, HBase and Hadoop, ZooKeeper, Mongo, Camel Master’s Degree, and Machine learning exposure are a plus Experience with communication and messaging applications Experience with security software and solutions Experience designing and implementing scalable, high performance, server side Java applications Experience with distributed systems, persistence, caching, concurrent programming ABOUT SYMPHONY'S TECHNOLOGY STACK We selected Apache Kafka, Apache Solr, MongoDB and HBase due to their superior distributed nature, performance, reliability, and ability to scale to the volume of data generated by the expected workload. We built out the ReSTFUL web services layer in a stateless manner using Apache Tomcat, meaning capacity could be added linearly, by simply adding more boxes behind the load balancer. The client front end was conceived as a web client that could be delivered on any device, any operating system, anywhere in the world. To build it, we chose HTML5/CSS3, with JQuery, Backbone and Handlebars doing the bulk of the heavy lifting. Symphony's front-end web application uses the modular pattern made popular in CommonJS, which builds each component as a loosely coupled anonymous closure. The core of the JavaScript app handles request transport details, new message notifications and updates, configuration of the UI layout, and much more. These functions are abstracted behind a public sandbox and selectively bundled into modules when the components are loaded. This architecture helps Symphony add new components quickly and seamlessly because they are isolated from each other, and lets developers control exactly how much of the app needs to load—an architecture specifically designed for integration and customization. ABOUT SYMPHONY Designed for the exchange of high-value content, Symphony is a secure communication and workflow platform that improves workplace productivity and connects users to their professional and personal community. Symphony has attracted the world’s top financial institutions with a $66 million investment to develop a scalable, cloud-based and highly secure collaboration and communication platform that will address the enterprise and compliance requirements for the financial services industry. The Symphony platform is intended to be used by some of the most time-conscious firms on the planet who are regularly corresponding high-value information—where a delay of a few seconds can have significant cost implications. Symphony’s secure communication platform will be available to all financial institutions and professionals world-wide in mid-2015. Now we’re looking for top-notch engineers, programmers and marketers (etc.) to join our team in Palo Alto, CA and New York to help us change the way the world communicates. If you have the skills and savvy to work with a world-class team, and an appetite for game-changing disruption, we definitely want to hear from you. COMPENSATION Competitive Base Salary and Incentive (Stock Option) plan / Health/Dental/Vision/401k (We accept existing H1B Visa applicants) Symphony appreciates your interest in our company. Symphony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. software engineer	10001	30	100	fulltime	0	Date: Immediate Location: New York, NY Type: FTE (Full Time Employee) JOB DESCRIPTION Symphony is looking for a senior-level, server-side Java software engineer to support its exponential growth. As a Symphony Backend Engineer, you'll be designing and implementing the cloud-based server-side logic for our secure communications platform. Working closely with Symphony’s industry partners and large financial clients, you will help design and integrate external platforms with Symphony’s enterprise-class, secure, end-to-end encrypted messaging application. Our engineers design and implement utilizing open source stacks (e.g. hbase, kafka, solr), extreme scaling within the cloud, and encryption in transit/at rest. This role is for a strong hands-on software engineer who also has outstanding communications skills. The successful candidate will be ready for a role that includes both directly contributing to the development of Symphony’s platform integration interfaces, and has the strong relationship management and communications skills to work directly with outside organizations to help create a complete technical solution. Why you are needed now: Symphony is a secure messaging startup backed by an array of the world’s leading financial institutions. Our clients and industry partners aim to create rich integrations with the Symphony front-end: Huge customer and industry demand for connections with 3rd party content and integration, and connections to enterprise applications Each one of these features needs to be maintainable, secure, and scalable to a large number of partner integrations Symphony is designed as an open platform which enables widespread integration. Platform integration is core to our product strategy. The problems you will be solving: Provide sophisticated back-end integration hooks to deliver hooks into Symphony’s core messaging platform, supporting integration with secure message “bots,” content and trading platform information feeds, and other server-side applications. Our clients are large, sophisticated global enterprises who seek to integrate Symphony in a complex fashion with their internal systems. Our partners include many application and content providers. Handling these complex stakeholders and delivering a strategic solution is the core of this challenging and crucial role. RESPONSIBILITIES Participate in development of Symphony's Server / Backend Development Work with clients and industry partners to explain how our interfaces work and assist in integrating with Symphony at both an architectural and code level Design, implement and test highly scalable, multi-tier, distributed server software applications Design and implement distributed and highly concurrent Java based enterprise services Create maintainable and scalable features fit for use by demanding enterprise clients QUALIFICATIONS Outstanding technical communications skills and stakeholder management 10+ years experience in a Java server-side software design and development Solid background in fundamentals of computer science and development process Experience developing high quality centralized server based apps Experience with open source frameworks and tools BS or MS degree in Computer Science or a related technical field DESIRED BUT NOT REQUIRED NoSQL and SQL databases Experience deploying server applications on Google App Engine (GAE), Google Compute Engine GCE and Amazon Web Service (AWS) Experience with any of the following: Kafka, Solr, Tomcat, HBase and Hadoop, ZooKeeper, Mongo, Camel Master’s Degree, and Machine learning exposure are a plus Experience with communication and messaging applications Experience with security software and solutions Experience designing and implementing scalable, high performance, server side Java applications Experience with distributed systems, persistence, caching, concurrent programming ABOUT SYMPHONY'S TECHNOLOGY STACK We selected Apache Kafka, Apache Solr, MongoDB and HBase due to their superior distributed nature, performance, reliability, and ability to scale to the volume of data generated by the expected workload. We built out the ReSTFUL web services layer in a stateless manner using Apache Tomcat, meaning capacity could be added linearly, by simply adding more boxes behind the load balancer. The client front end was conceived as a web client that could be delivered on any device, any operating system, anywhere in the world. To build it, we chose HTML5/CSS3, with JQuery, Backbone and Handlebars doing the bulk of the heavy lifting. Symphony's front-end web application uses the modular pattern made popular in CommonJS, which builds each component as a loosely coupled anonymous closure. The core of the JavaScript app handles request transport details, new message notifications and updates, configuration of the UI layout, and much more. These functions are abstracted behind a public sandbox and selectively bundled into modules when the components are loaded. This architecture helps Symphony add new components quickly and seamlessly because they are isolated from each other, and lets developers control exactly how much of the app needs to load—an architecture specifically designed for integration and customization. ABOUT SYMPHONY Designed for the exchange of high-value content, Symphony is a secure communication and workflow platform that improves workplace productivity and connects users to their professional and personal community. Symphony has attracted the world’s top financial institutions with a $66 million investment to develop a scalable, cloud-based and highly secure collaboration and communication platform that will address the enterprise and compliance requirements for the financial services industry. The Symphony platform is intended to be used by some of the most time-conscious firms on the planet who are regularly corresponding high-value information—where a delay of a few seconds can have significant cost implications. Symphony’s secure communication platform will be available to all financial institutions and professionals world-wide in mid-2015. Now we’re looking for top-notch engineers, programmers and marketers (etc.) to join our team in Palo Alto, CA and New York to help us change the way the world communicates. If you have the skills and savvy to work with a world-class team, and an appetite for game-changing disruption, we definitely want to hear from you. COMPENSATION Competitive Base Salary and Incentive (Stock Option) plan / Health/Dental/Vision/401k (We accept existing H1B Visa applicants) Symphony appreciates your interest in our company. Symphony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. software engineer	10001	30	100	fulltime	0	Date: Immediate Location: New York, NY Type: FTE (Full Time Employee) JOB DESCRIPTION Symphony is looking for a senior-level, server-side Java software engineer to support its exponential growth. As a Symphony Backend Engineer, you'll be designing and implementing the cloud-based server-side logic for our secure communications platform. Working closely with Symphony’s industry partners and large financial clients, you will help design and integrate external platforms with Symphony’s enterprise-class, secure, end-to-end encrypted messaging application. Our engineers design and implement utilizing open source stacks (e.g. hbase, kafka, solr), extreme scaling within the cloud, and encryption in transit/at rest. This role is for a strong hands-on software engineer who also has outstanding communications skills. The successful candidate will be ready for a role that includes both directly contributing to the development of Symphony’s platform integration interfaces, and has the strong relationship management and communications skills to work directly with outside organizations to help create a complete technical solution. Why you are needed now: Symphony is a secure messaging startup backed by an array of the world’s leading financial institutions. Our clients and industry partners aim to create rich integrations with the Symphony front-end: Huge customer and industry demand for connections with 3rd party content and integration, and connections to enterprise applications Each one of these features needs to be maintainable, secure, and scalable to a large number of partner integrations Symphony is designed as an open platform which enables widespread integration. Platform integration is core to our product strategy. The problems you will be solving: Provide sophisticated back-end integration hooks to deliver hooks into Symphony’s core messaging platform, supporting integration with secure message “bots,” content and trading platform information feeds, and other server-side applications. Our clients are large, sophisticated global enterprises who seek to integrate Symphony in a complex fashion with their internal systems. Our partners include many application and content providers. Handling these complex stakeholders and delivering a strategic solution is the core of this challenging and crucial role. RESPONSIBILITIES Participate in development of Symphony's Server / Backend Development Work with clients and industry partners to explain how our interfaces work and assist in integrating with Symphony at both an architectural and code level Design, implement and test highly scalable, multi-tier, distributed server software applications Design and implement distributed and highly concurrent Java based enterprise services Create maintainable and scalable features fit for use by demanding enterprise clients QUALIFICATIONS Outstanding technical communications skills and stakeholder management 10+ years experience in a Java server-side software design and development Solid background in fundamentals of computer science and development process Experience developing high quality centralized server based apps Experience with open source frameworks and tools BS or MS degree in Computer Science or a related technical field DESIRED BUT NOT REQUIRED NoSQL and SQL databases Experience deploying server applications on Google App Engine (GAE), Google Compute Engine GCE and Amazon Web Service (AWS) Experience with any of the following: Kafka, Solr, Tomcat, HBase and Hadoop, ZooKeeper, Mongo, Camel Master’s Degree, and Machine learning exposure are a plus Experience with communication and messaging applications Experience with security software and solutions Experience designing and implementing scalable, high performance, server side Java applications Experience with distributed systems, persistence, caching, concurrent programming ABOUT SYMPHONY'S TECHNOLOGY STACK We selected Apache Kafka, Apache Solr, MongoDB and HBase due to their superior distributed nature, performance, reliability, and ability to scale to the volume of data generated by the expected workload. We built out the ReSTFUL web services layer in a stateless manner using Apache Tomcat, meaning capacity could be added linearly, by simply adding more boxes behind the load balancer. The client front end was conceived as a web client that could be delivered on any device, any operating system, anywhere in the world. To build it, we chose HTML5/CSS3, with JQuery, Backbone and Handlebars doing the bulk of the heavy lifting. Symphony's front-end web application uses the modular pattern made popular in CommonJS, which builds each component as a loosely coupled anonymous closure. The core of the JavaScript app handles request transport details, new message notifications and updates, configuration of the UI layout, and much more. These functions are abstracted behind a public sandbox and selectively bundled into modules when the components are loaded. This architecture helps Symphony add new components quickly and seamlessly because they are isolated from each other, and lets developers control exactly how much of the app needs to load—an architecture specifically designed for integration and customization. ABOUT SYMPHONY Designed for the exchange of high-value content, Symphony is a secure communication and workflow platform that improves workplace productivity and connects users to their professional and personal community. Symphony has attracted the world’s top financial institutions with a $66 million investment to develop a scalable, cloud-based and highly secure collaboration and communication platform that will address the enterprise and compliance requirements for the financial services industry. The Symphony platform is intended to be used by some of the most time-conscious firms on the planet who are regularly corresponding high-value information—where a delay of a few seconds can have significant cost implications. Symphony’s secure communication platform will be available to all financial institutions and professionals world-wide in mid-2015. Now we’re looking for top-notch engineers, programmers and marketers (etc.) to join our team in Palo Alto, CA and New York to help us change the way the world communicates. If you have the skills and savvy to work with a world-class team, and an appetite for game-changing disruption, we definitely want to hear from you. software engineer	10001	30	100	fulltime	0	Date: Immediate Location: New York, NY Type: FTE (Full Time Employee) JOB DESCRIPTION Symphony is looking for a senior-level, server-side Java software engineer to support its exponential growth. As a Symphony Backend Engineer, you'll be designing and implementing the cloud-based server-side logic for our secure communications platform. Working closely with Symphony’s industry partners and large financial clients, you will help design and integrate external platforms with Symphony’s enterprise-class, secure, end-to-end encrypted messaging application. Our engineers design and implement utilizing open source stacks (e.g. hbase, kafka, solr), extreme scaling within the cloud, and encryption in transit/at rest. This role is for a strong hands-on software engineer who also has outstanding communications skills. The successful candidate will be ready for a role that includes both directly contributing to the development of Symphony’s platform integration interfaces, and has the strong relationship management and communications skills to work directly with outside organizations to help create a complete technical solution. Why you are needed now: Symphony is a secure messaging startup backed by an array of the world’s leading financial institutions. Our clients and industry partners aim to create rich integrations with the Symphony front-end: Huge customer and industry demand for connections with 3rd party content and integration, and connections to enterprise applications Each one of these features needs to be maintainable, secure, and scalable to a large number of partner integrations Symphony is designed as an open platform which enables widespread integration. Platform integration is core to our product strategy. The problems you will be solving: Provide sophisticated back-end integration hooks to deliver hooks into Symphony’s core messaging platform, supporting integration with secure message “bots,” content and trading platform information feeds, and other server-side applications. Our clients are large, sophisticated global enterprises who seek to integrate Symphony in a complex fashion with their internal systems. Our partners include many application and content providers. Handling these complex stakeholders and delivering a strategic solution is the core of this challenging and crucial role. RESPONSIBILITIES Participate in development of Symphony's Server / Backend Development Work with clients and industry partners to explain how our interfaces work and assist in integrating with Symphony at both an architectural and code level Design, implement and test highly scalable, multi-tier, distributed server software applications Design and implement distributed and highly concurrent Java based enterprise services Create maintainable and scalable features fit for use by demanding enterprise clients QUALIFICATIONS Outstanding technical communications skills and stakeholder management 10+ years experience in a Java server-side software design and development Solid background in fundamentals of computer science and development process Experience developing high quality centralized server based apps Experience with open source frameworks and tools BS or MS degree in Computer Science or a related technical field DESIRED BUT NOT REQUIRED NoSQL and SQL databases Experience deploying server applications on Google App Engine (GAE), Google Compute Engine GCE and Amazon Web Service (AWS) Experience with any of the following: Kafka, Solr, Tomcat, HBase and Hadoop, ZooKeeper, Mongo, Camel Master’s Degree, and Machine learning exposure are a plus Experience with communication and messaging applications Experience with security software and solutions Experience designing and implementing scalable, high performance, server side Java applications Experience with distributed systems, persistence, caching, concurrent programming ABOUT SYMPHONY'S TECHNOLOGY STACK We selected Apache Kafka, Apache Solr, MongoDB and HBase due to their superior distributed nature, performance, reliability, and ability to scale to the volume of data generated by the expected workload. We built out the ReSTFUL web services layer in a stateless manner using Apache Tomcat, meaning capacity could be added linearly, by simply adding more boxes behind the load balancer. The client front end was conceived as a web client that could be delivered on any device, any operating system, anywhere in the world. To build it, we chose HTML5/CSS3, with JQuery, Backbone and Handlebars doing the bulk of the heavy lifting. Symphony's front-end web application uses the modular pattern made popular in CommonJS, which builds each component as a loosely coupled anonymous closure. The core of the JavaScript app handles request transport details, new message notifications and updates, configuration of the UI layout, and much more. These functions are abstracted behind a public sandbox and selectively bundled into modules when the components are loaded. This architecture helps Symphony add new components quickly and seamlessly because they are isolated from each other, and lets developers control exactly how much of the app needs to load—an architecture specifically designed for integration and customization. ABOUT SYMPHONY Designed for the exchange of high-value content, Symphony is a secure communication and workflow platform that improves workplace productivity and connects users to their professional and personal community. Symphony has attracted the world’s top financial institutions with a $66 million investment to develop a scalable, cloud-based and highly secure collaboration and communication platform that will address the enterprise and compliance requirements for the financial services industry. The Symphony platform is intended to be used by some of the most time-conscious firms on the planet who are regularly corresponding high-value information—where a delay of a few seconds can have significant cost implications. Symphony’s secure communication platform will be available to all financial institutions and professionals world-wide in mid-2015. Now we’re looking for top-notch engineers, programmers and marketers (etc.) to join our team in Palo Alto, CA and New York to help us change the way the world communicates. If you have the skills and savvy to work with a world-class team, and an appetite for game-changing disruption, we definitely want to hear from you. COMPENSATION Competitive Base Salary and Incentive (Stock Option) plan / Health/Dental/Vision/401k (We accept existing H1B Visa applicants) Symphony appreciates your interest in our company. Symphony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. As a Symphony Backend Engineer, you'll be designing and implementing the cloud-based server-side logic for our secure communications platform. Working closely with Symphony’s industry partners and large financial clients, you will help design and integrate external platforms with Symphony’s enterprise-class, secure, end-to-end encrypted messaging application. Our engineers design and implement utilizing open source stacks (e.g. hbase, kafka, solr), extreme scaling within the cloud, and encryption in transit/at rest. This role is for a strong hands-on software engineer who also has outstanding communications skills. The successful candidate will be ready for a role that includes both directly contributing to the development of Symphony’s platform integration interfaces, and has the strong relationship management and communications skills to work directly with outside organizations to help create a complete technical solution. Why you are needed now: Symphony is a secure messaging startup backed by an array of the world’s leading financial institutions. Our clients and industry partners aim to create rich integrations with the Symphony front-end: Huge customer and industry demand for connections with 3rd party content and integration, and connections to enterprise applications Each one of these features needs to be maintainable, secure, and scalable to a large number of partner integrations Symphony is designed as an open platform which enables widespread integration. Platform integration is core to our product strategy. The problems you will be solving: Provide sophisticated back-end integration hooks to deliver hooks into Symphony’s core messaging platform, supporting integration with secure message “bots,” content and trading platform information feeds, and other server-side applications. Our clients are large, sophisticated global enterprises who seek to integrate Symphony in a complex fashion with their internal systems. Our partners include many application and content providers. Handling these complex stakeholders and delivering a strategic solution is the core of this challenging and crucial role. RESPONSIBILITIES Participate in development of Symphony's Server / Backend Development Work with clients and industry partners to explain how our interfaces work and assist in integrating with Symphony at both an architectural and code level Design, implement and test highly scalable, multi-tier, distributed server software applications Design and implement distributed and highly concurrent Java based enterprise services Create maintainable and scalable features fit for use by demanding enterprise clients QUALIFICATIONS Outstanding technical communications skills and stakeholder management 10+ years experience in a Java server-side software design and development Solid background in fundamentals of computer science and development process Experience developing high quality centralized server based apps Experience with open source frameworks and tools BS or MS degree in Computer Science or a related technical field DESIRED BUT NOT REQUIRED NoSQL and SQL databases Experience deploying server applications on Google App Engine (GAE), Google Compute Engine GCE and Amazon Web Service (AWS) Experience with any of the following: Kafka, Solr, Tomcat, HBase and Hadoop, ZooKeeper, Mongo, Camel Master’s Degree, and Machine learning exposure are a plus Experience with communication and messaging applications Experience with security software and solutions Experience designing and implementing scalable, high performance, server side Java applications Experience with distributed systems, persistence, caching, concurrent programming ABOUT SYMPHONY'S TECHNOLOGY STACK We selected Apache Kafka, Apache Solr, MongoDB and HBase due to their superior distributed nature, performance, reliability, and ability to scale to the volume of data generated by the expected workload. We built out the ReSTFUL web services layer in a stateless manner using Apache Tomcat, meaning capacity could be added linearly, by simply adding more boxes behind the load balancer. The client front end was conceived as a web client that could be delivered on any device, any operating system, anywhere in the world. To build it, we chose HTML5/CSS3, with JQuery, Backbone and Handlebars doing the bulk of the heavy lifting. Symphony's front-end web application uses the modular pattern made popular in CommonJS, which builds each component as a loosely coupled anonymous closure. The core of the JavaScript app handles request transport details, new message notifications and updates, configuration of the UI layout, and much more. These functions are abstracted behind a public sandbox and selectively bundled into modules when the components are loaded. This architecture helps Symphony add new components quickly and seamlessly because they are isolated from each other, and lets developers control exactly how much of the app needs to load—an architecture specifically designed for integration and customization. ABOUT SYMPHONY Designed for the exchange of high-value content, Symphony is a secure communication and workflow platform that improves workplace productivity and connects users to their professional and personal community. Symphony has attracted the world’s top financial institutions with a $66 million investment to develop a scalable, cloud-based and highly secure collaboration and communication platform that will address the enterprise and compliance requirements for the financial services industry. The Symphony platform is intended to be used by some of the most time-conscious firms on the planet who are regularly corresponding high-value information—where a delay of a few seconds can have significant cost implications. Symphony’s secure communication platform will be available to all financial institutions and professionals world-wide in mid-2015. Now we’re looking for top-notch engineers, programmers and marketers (etc.) to join our team in Palo Alto, CA and New York to help us change the way the world communicates. If you have the skills and savvy to work with a world-class team, and an appetite for game-changing disruption, we definitely want to hear from you. software engineer	10001	30	100	fulltime	0	Date: Immediate Location: New York, NY Type: FTE (Full Time Employee) JOB DESCRIPTION Symphony is looking for a senior-level, server-side Java software engineer to support its exponential growth. As a Symphony Backend Engineer, you'll be designing and implementing the cloud-based server-side logic for our secure communications platform. Working closely with Symphony’s industry partners and large financial clients, you will help design and integrate external platforms with Symphony’s enterprise-class, secure, end-to-end encrypted messaging application. Our engineers design and implement utilizing open source stacks (e.g. hbase, kafka, solr), extreme scaling within the cloud, and encryption in transit/at rest. This role is for a strong hands-on software engineer who also has outstanding communications skills. The successful candidate will be ready for a role that includes both directly contributing to the development of Symphony’s platform integration interfaces, and has the strong relationship management and communications skills to work directly with outside organizations to help create a complete technical solution. Why you are needed now: Symphony is a secure messaging startup backed by an array of the world’s leading financial institutions. Our clients and industry partners aim to create rich integrations with the Symphony front-end: Huge customer and industry demand for connections with 3rd party content and integration, and connections to enterprise applications Each one of these features needs to be maintainable, secure, and scalable to a large number of partner integrations Symphony is designed as an open platform which enables widespread integration. Platform integration is core to our product strategy. The problems you will be solving: Provide sophisticated back-end integration hooks to deliver hooks into Symphony’s core messaging platform, supporting integration with secure message “bots,” content and trading platform information feeds, and other server-side applications. Our clients are large, sophisticated global enterprises who seek to integrate Symphony in a complex fashion with their internal systems. Our partners include many application and content providers. Handling these complex stakeholders and delivering a strategic solution is the core of this challenging and crucial role. RESPONSIBILITIES Participate in development of Symphony's Server / Backend Development Work with clients and industry partners to explain how our interfaces work and assist in integrating with Symphony at both an architectural and code level Design, implement and test highly scalable, multi-tier, distributed server software applications Design and implement distributed and highly concurrent Java based enterprise services Create maintainable and scalable features fit for use by demanding enterprise clients QUALIFICATIONS Outstanding technical communications skills and stakeholder management 10+ years experience in a Java server-side software design and development Solid background in fundamentals of computer science and development process Experience developing high quality centralized server based apps Experience with open source frameworks and tools BS or MS degree in Computer Science or a related technical field DESIRED BUT NOT REQUIRED NoSQL and SQL databases Experience deploying server applications on Google App Engine (GAE), Google Compute Engine GCE and Amazon Web Service (AWS) Experience with any of the following: Kafka, Solr, Tomcat, HBase and Hadoop, ZooKeeper, Mongo, Camel Master’s Degree, and Machine learning exposure are a plus Experience with communication and messaging applications Experience with security software and solutions Experience designing and implementing scalable, high performance, server side Java applications Experience with distributed systems, persistence, caching, concurrent programming ABOUT SYMPHONY'S TECHNOLOGY STACK We selected Apache Kafka, Apache Solr, MongoDB and HBase due to their superior distributed nature, performance, reliability, and ability to scale to the volume of data generated by the expected workload. We built out the ReSTFUL web services layer in a stateless manner using Apache Tomcat, meaning capacity could be added linearly, by simply adding more boxes behind the load balancer. The client front end was conceived as a web client that could be delivered on any device, any operating system, anywhere in the world. To build it, we chose HTML5/CSS3, with JQuery, Backbone and Handlebars doing the bulk of the heavy lifting. Symphony's front-end web application uses the modular pattern made popular in CommonJS, which builds each component as a loosely coupled anonymous closure. The core of the JavaScript app handles request transport details, new message notifications and updates, configuration of the UI layout, and much more. These functions are abstracted behind a public sandbox and selectively bundled into modules when the components are loaded. This architecture helps Symphony add new components quickly and seamlessly because they are isolated from each other, and lets developers control exactly how much of the app needs to load—an architecture specifically designed for integration and customization. ABOUT SYMPHONY Designed for the exchange of high-value content, Symphony is a secure communication and workflow platform that improves workplace productivity and connects users to their professional and personal community. Symphony has attracted the world’s top financial institutions with a $66 million investment to develop a scalable, cloud-based and highly secure collaboration and communication platform that will address the enterprise and compliance requirements for the financial services industry. The Symphony platform is intended to be used by some of the most time-conscious firms on the planet who are regularly corresponding high-value information—where a delay of a few seconds can have significant cost implications. Symphony’s secure communication platform will be available to all financial institutions and professionals world-wide in mid-2015. Now we’re looking for top-notch engineers, programmers and marketers (etc.) to join our team in Palo Alto, CA and New York to help us change the way the world communicates. If you have the skills and savvy to work with a world-class team, and an appetite for game-changing disruption, we definitely want to hear from you.
