software engineer	10001	30	100	fulltime	0	Date: Immediate Location: New York, NY Type: FTE (Full Time Employee) JOB DESCRIPTION Symphony is looking for a senior-level, server-side Java software engineer to support its exponential growth. As a Symphony Backend Engineer, you'll be designing and implementing the cloud-based server-side logic for our secure communications platform. Working closely with Symphony’s industry partners and large financial clients, you will help design and integrate external platforms with Symphony’s enterprise-class, secure, end-to-end encrypted messaging application. Our engineers design and implement utilizing open source stacks (e.g. hbase, kafka, solr), extreme scaling within the cloud, and encryption in transit/at rest. This role is for a strong hands-on software engineer who also has outstanding communications skills. The successful candidate will be ready for a role that includes both directly contributing to the development of Symphony’s platform integration interfaces, and has the strong relationship management and communications skills to work directly with outside organizations to help create a complete technical solution. Why you are needed now: Symphony is a secure messaging startup backed by an array of the world’s leading financial institutions. Our clients and industry partners aim to create rich integrations with the Symphony front-end: Huge customer and industry demand for connections with 3rd party content and integration, and connections to enterprise applications Each one of these features needs to be maintainable, secure, and scalable to a large number of partner integrations Symphony is designed as an open platform which enables widespread integration. Platform integration is core to our product strategy. The problems you will be solving: Provide sophisticated back-end integration hooks to deliver hooks into Symphony’s core messaging platform, supporting integration with secure message “bots,” content and trading platform information feeds, and other server-side applications. Our clients are large, sophisticated global enterprises who seek to integrate Symphony in a complex fashion with their internal systems. Our partners include many application and content providers. Handling these complex stakeholders and delivering a strategic solution is the core of this challenging and crucial role. RESPONSIBILITIES Participate in development of Symphony's Server / Backend Development Work with clients and industry partners to explain how our interfaces work and assist in integrating with Symphony at both an architectural and code level Design, implement and test highly scalable, multi-tier, distributed server software applications Design and implement distributed and highly concurrent Java based enterprise services Create maintainable and scalable features fit for use by demanding enterprise clients QUALIFICATIONS Outstanding technical communications skills and stakeholder management 10+ years experience in a Java server-side software design and development Solid background in fundamentals of computer science and development process Experience developing high quality centralized server based apps Experience with open source frameworks and tools BS or MS degree in Computer Science or a related technical field DESIRED BUT NOT REQUIRED NoSQL and SQL databases Experience deploying server applications on Google App Engine (GAE), Google Compute Engine GCE and Amazon Web Service (AWS) Experience with any of the following: Kafka, Solr, Tomcat, HBase and Hadoop, ZooKeeper, Mongo, Camel Master’s Degree, and Machine learning exposure are a plus Experience with communication and messaging applications Experience with security software and solutions Experience designing and implementing scalable, high performance, server side Java applications Experience with distributed systems, persistence, caching, concurrent programming ABOUT SYMPHONY'S TECHNOLOGY STACK We selected Apache Kafka, Apache Solr, MongoDB and HBase due to their superior distributed nature, performance, reliability, and ability to scale to the volume of data generated by the expected workload. We built out the ReSTFUL web services layer in a stateless manner using Apache Tomcat, meaning capacity could be added linearly, by simply adding more boxes behind the load balancer. The client front end was conceived as a web client that could be delivered on any device, any operating system, anywhere in the world. To build it, we chose HTML5/CSS3, with JQuery, Backbone and Handlebars doing the bulk of the heavy lifting. Symphony's front-end web application uses the modular pattern made popular in CommonJS, which builds each component as a loosely coupled anonymous closure. The core of the JavaScript app handles request transport details, new message notifications and updates, configuration of the UI layout, and much more. These functions are abstracted behind a public sandbox and selectively bundled into modules when the components are loaded. This architecture helps Symphony add new components quickly and seamlessly because they are isolated from each other, and lets developers control exactly how much of the app needs to load—an architecture specifically designed for integration and customization. ABOUT SYMPHONY Designed for the exchange of high-value content, Symphony is a secure communication and workflow platform that improves workplace productivity and connects users to their professional and personal community. Symphony has attracted the world’s top financial institutions with a $66 million investment to develop a scalable, cloud-based and highly secure collaboration and communication platform that will address the enterprise and compliance requirements for the financial services industry. The Symphony platform is intended to be used by some of the most time-conscious firms on the planet who are regularly corresponding high-value information—where a delay of a few seconds can have significant cost implications. Symphony’s secure communication platform will be available to all financial institutions and professionals world-wide in mid-2015. Now we’re looking for top-notch engineers, programmers and marketers (etc.) to join our team in Palo Alto, CA and New York to help us change the way the world communicates. If you have the skills and savvy to work with a world-class team, and an appetite for game-changing disruption, we definitely want to hear from you. COMPENSATION Competitive Base Salary and Incentive (Stock Option) plan / Health/Dental/Vision/401k (We accept existing H1B Visa applicants) Symphony appreciates your interest in our company. Symphony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. software engineer	10001	30	100	fulltime	0	Date: Immediate Location: New York, NY Type: FTE (Full Time Employee) JOB DESCRIPTION Symphony is looking for a senior-level, server-side Java software engineer to support its exponential growth. As a Symphony Backend Engineer, you'll be designing and implementing the cloud-based server-side logic for our secure communications platform. Working closely with Symphony’s industry partners and large financial clients, you will help design and integrate external platforms with Symphony’s enterprise-class, secure, end-to-end encrypted messaging application. Our engineers design and implement utilizing open source stacks (e.g. hbase, kafka, solr), extreme scaling within the cloud, and encryption in transit/at rest. This role is for a strong hands-on software engineer who also has outstanding communications skills. The successful candidate will be ready for a role that includes both directly contributing to the development of Symphony’s platform integration interfaces, and has the strong relationship management and communications skills to work directly with outside organizations to help create a complete technical solution. Why you are needed now: Symphony is a secure messaging startup backed by an array of the world’s leading financial institutions. Our clients and industry partners aim to create rich integrations with the Symphony front-end: Huge customer and industry demand for connections with 3rd party content and integration, and connections to enterprise applications Each one of these features needs to be maintainable, secure, and scalable to a large number of partner integrations Symphony is designed as an open platform which enables widespread integration. Platform integration is core to our product strategy. The problems you will be solving: Provide sophisticated back-end integration hooks to deliver hooks into Symphony’s core messaging platform, supporting integration with secure message “bots,” content and trading platform information feeds, and other server-side applications. Our clients are large, sophisticated global enterprises who seek to integrate Symphony in a complex fashion with their internal systems. Our partners include many application and content providers. Handling these complex stakeholders and delivering a strategic solution is the core of this challenging and crucial role. RESPONSIBILITIES Participate in development of Symphony's Server / Backend Development Work with clients and industry partners to explain how our interfaces work and assist in integrating with Symphony at both an architectural and code level Design, implement and test highly scalable, multi-tier, distributed server software applications Design and implement distributed and highly concurrent Java based enterprise services Create maintainable and scalable features fit for use by demanding enterprise clients QUALIFICATIONS Outstanding technical communications skills and stakeholder management 10+ years experience in a Java server-side software design and development Solid background in fundamentals of computer science and development process Experience developing high quality centralized server based apps Experience with open source frameworks and tools BS or MS degree in Computer Science or a related technical field DESIRED BUT NOT REQUIRED NoSQL and SQL databases Experience deploying server applications on Google App Engine (GAE), Google Compute Engine GCE and Amazon Web Service (AWS) Experience with any of the following: Kafka, Solr, Tomcat, HBase and Hadoop, ZooKeeper, Mongo, Camel Master’s Degree, and Machine learning exposure are a plus Experience with communication and messaging applications Experience with security software and solutions Experience designing and implementing scalable, high performance, server side Java applications Experience with distributed systems, persistence, caching, concurrent programming ABOUT SYMPHONY'S TECHNOLOGY STACK We selected Apache Kafka, Apache Solr, MongoDB and HBase due to their superior distributed nature, performance, reliability, and ability to scale to the volume of data generated by the expected workload. We built out the ReSTFUL web services layer in a stateless manner using Apache Tomcat, meaning capacity could be added linearly, by simply adding more boxes behind the load balancer. The client front end was conceived as a web client that could be delivered on any device, any operating system, anywhere in the world. To build it, we chose HTML5/CSS3, with JQuery, Backbone and Handlebars doing the bulk of the heavy lifting. Symphony's front-end web application uses the modular pattern made popular in CommonJS, which builds each component as a loosely coupled anonymous closure. The core of the JavaScript app handles request transport details, new message notifications and updates, configuration of the UI layout, and much more. These functions are abstracted behind a public sandbox and selectively bundled into modules when the components are loaded. This architecture helps Symphony add new components quickly and seamlessly because they are isolated from each other, and lets developers control exactly how much of the app needs to load—an architecture specifically designed for integration and customization. ABOUT SYMPHONY Designed for the exchange of high-value content, Symphony is a secure communication and workflow platform that improves workplace productivity and connects users to their professional and personal community. Symphony has attracted the world’s top financial institutions with a $66 million investment to develop a scalable, cloud-based and highly secure collaboration and communication platform that will address the enterprise and compliance requirements for the financial services industry. The Symphony platform is intended to be used by some of the most time-conscious firms on the planet who are regularly corresponding high-value information—where a delay of a few seconds can have significant cost implications. Symphony’s secure communication platform will be available to all financial institutions and professionals world-wide in mid-2015. Now we’re looking for top-notch engineers, programmers and marketers (etc.) to join our team in Palo Alto, CA and New York to help us change the way the world communicates. If you have the skills and savvy to work with a world-class team, and an appetite for game-changing disruption, we definitely want to hear from you. COMPENSATION Competitive Base Salary and Incentive (Stock Option) plan / Health/Dental/Vision/401k (We accept existing H1B Visa applicants) Symphony appreciates your interest in our company.
